intro: Echium triste subsp. triste, commonly known as the weeping thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features tall, spindly stems with purple-blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can also be found in wild habitats.
